answers.answer: get a vascular consultation.  sometimes, the legs swell b/c the veins are incompetant and can not push the fluids back up the legs.  also, have your pcp rule out masses that can press on the lymphatics that can cause back flow of fluids.

Get a second and third opinion if you have to. Find and internist that can give you a thorough physical. Swelling of this type is not normal. Sounds like you are retaining fluid for whatever reason. Do you take diuretics prescribed by a doctor? Don't give up, keep searching until you find a doctor that can give you some answers. It's your life, your health and you have to be your own advocate. Good luck.
